articles.text: What is the benefit of writing plugins in lua?
articles.desc: I hear that Lua is a first-class language for neovim but I'm not really sure what that means. Can someone explain what neovim-specific benefits there are to writing your plugin in Lua?

articles.text: How to write neovim plugins in lua
articles.desc: One of goals which neovim devs set for themselves, was making lua the first-class scripting language alternative to viml. Since version 0.4 its' interpreter along with 'stdlib' have been already built into the editor.
I want to illustrate the process of learning how to take advantage of the powerful scripting capabilities that are available in the Neovim runtime.
